conclusion: The wire is bent into a V-shape with two equal sides, each of length l, and the angle between the two sides is 60 degrees.
The force on a segment of wire carrying current I in a magnetic field B is given by F = I L B sin(theta), where theta is the angle between the wire and the magnetic field.
Since the magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the wire, theta = 90 degrees for both segments, so the force on each segment is F = I l B.
The forces on the two segments will be at an angle of 60 degrees to each other.
The resultant force can be found using the law of cosines: F_resultant = sqrt(F_1^2 + F_2^2 + 2 F_1 F_2 cos(phi)), where F_1 = F_2 = I l B and phi = 60 degrees.
Calculate the resultant force: F_resultant = sqrt(3 I^2 l^2 B^2), which simplifies to F_resultant = I l B sqrt(3).
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped current-carrying wire is I l B sqrt(3).
